title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Part (a): 2 points

One point is earned for each of two explanations of measures taken by some states that affected voter turnout among African American citizens. Acceptable explanations are:

Literacy tests

Poll taxes

Grandfather clauses

Dilution of voting strength through redistricting

White primaries

Election procedures (notification, access)
descriptions: A score of zero (0) is earned for an attempted answer that earns no points.

The student response provided a correct explanation of measures taken by some states that affected voter turnout among African American citizens. Acceptable explanations are:

Literacy tests

Poll taxes

Grandfather clauses

Dilution of voting strength through redistricting

White primaries

Election procedures (notification, access)

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Part (b): 2 points

One point is earned for each of two descriptions of alternative forms of participation. Acceptable descriptions are:

Demonstrations/protests/public rallies/civil disobedience

Organized interest-group activity (e.g., NAACP)

Courts/litigation

Boycotts

Election activities other than voting (campaigning, donating)
descriptions: A score of zero (0) is earned for an attempted answer that earns no points.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Part (c): 1 point

One point is earned for a correct explanation of why an alternative form of participation was effective in changing civil rights policies based on the response in (b).

The response must explain how or why policy outputs or outcomes result from participation, including the following three elements:

  • Participation

  • Linkage

  • mechanism

Policy output or outcome
descriptions: A score of zero (0) is earned for an attempted answer that earns no points.
The student response provided a correct explanation of why an alternative form of participation was effective in changing civil rights policies based on the response in (b).
